svcsubproc.title: Vandal Lock
svcsubproc.para: The vandal lock option is located forward of the side entry door below the passenger side windshield wing panel. To remove the vandal lock assembly the passenger side glove box and entry way dash trim panel must be removed.
Refer to Figure 108 for all Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Beginning at the passenger side at the step well, locate the mounting screws attaching the glove box assembly to the heater assembly flange.
Remove the 4 mounting screws (Item 9) attaching the glove box to the heated face plate.

figure.caption: Figure 108. Panel Removal to Access Vandal Lock

calloutgroup.callout1: GLOVE BOX LOCATOR ANGLE MOUNTING SCREWS (5)

step1.para: Locate the mounting screws along the bottom edge of the glove box assembly (Item 8).
Loosen and remove the 5 mounting screws.
Locate the 8 mounting screws on the entry dash trim panel (Item 3).
Remove the mounting screws from the trim panel, slide the trim panel (Item 2) toward step well to release lower flange insert.
Locate and remove the glove box mounting screws (Item 5) along the locator angle (Item 6) and windshield ledge (Item 4) assembly.
Slide the glove box assembly toward the step well to expose the heater vent hose connections at the rear of the glove box face panel.
Loosen the vent hose clamps and disconnect vent hoses from vent assemblies.
Remove the entire glove box assembly and locate the vandal lock assembly and connecting harness.

figure.caption: Figure 109. Disconnect Wire Connections- Vandal Lock

step1.para: Loosen the vandal lock interior surface lock jam nut.
Loosen and remove the exterior trim ring on vandal lock key shaft.
Loosen the lock ring on the outside body panel section of the vehicle, remove the nut and washer.
Remove the vandal lock assembly out of the mounting hole from inside.
